snippet: Three families and eight children lived in a 19th-century Brooklyn brownstone when part of it came crashing down. Nobody was hurt.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column describes the sudden collapse of a back wall of an1840s brownstone on Carroll Street in Brooklyn; says cause of collapse is under investigation, but one possible factor is that an adjoining building was torn down in the 1950s to make way for a school, possibly causing long-term instability.
lead_paragraph: Three families and eight children lived in a 19th-century Brooklyn brownstone when part of it came crashing down. Nobody was hurt.

headline.seo: Amid Collapsing Walls, a Bit of Luck for 3 Brooklyn Families
headline.main: Amid Collapsing Walls, a Bit of Luck for 3 Families
headline.print_headline: Amid Falling Walls, Some Good Luck For 3 Families
